        Requesting merge to stable M112 because latest trunk commit (1126483) appears to be after stable branch point (1109224).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to stable M112 because latest trunk commit (1126483) appears to be after stable branch point (1109224).<!----></span><br><br>Requesting merge to beta M113 because latest trunk commit (1126483) appears to be after beta branch point (1121455).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to beta M113 because latest trunk commit (1126483) appears to be after beta branch point (1121455).<!----></span><br><br>Merge review required: M112 is already shipping to stable.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M112 is already shipping to stable.<!----></span><br><br>Merge review required: M113 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M113 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you for fixing this security bug! We aim to ship security fixes as quickly as possible, to limit their opportunity for exploitation as an "n-day" (that is, a bug where git fixes are developed into attacks before those fixes reach users).<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for fixing this security bug! Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<!----></span><br><br>Yes, but this fix must be independent from the changes.  That is because:<span class="line"><!---->Yes, but this fix must be independent from the changes.  That is because:<!----></span><br>- the fix only updates the way to decide fetch_handler_type, and the code change won't be scattered.  User of the fetch_handler_type do not need to be updated for the change.<span class="line"><!---->- the fix only updates the way to decide fetch_handler_type, and the code change won't be scattered.  User of the fetch_handler_type do not need to be updated for the change.<!----></span><br>- and, major implementations for the feature has already been shipped as M106, and no large scale code update is needed for the way we handle fetch_handler_type.<span class="line"><!---->- and, major implementations for the feature has already been shipped as M106, and no large scale code update is needed for the way we handle fetch_handler_type.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1429201%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D500" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1429201%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D500%252526ust%25253D1703398867765758%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw3xoXO_xcOnV090v-nZdD-Y%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }

          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<span class="line"><!---->In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<!----></span><br><br>bisect: This was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->bisect: This was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<!----></a><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType<span class="line"><!---->mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType() {<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType() {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  for (RegisteredEventListener& e : *elv) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (RegisteredEventListener&amp; e : *elv) {<!----></span><br>    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()->GetScriptState());<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()-&gt;GetScriptState());<!----></span><br>    v8::Local<v8::Value> v =<span class="line"><!---->    v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; v =<!----></span><br>        To<JSBasedEventListener>(e.Callback())->GetEffectiveFunction(*et);    // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->        To&lt;JSBasedEventListener&gt;(e.Callback())-&gt;GetEffectiveFunction(*et);    // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>    if (!v->IsFunction() ||<span class="line"><!---->    if (!v-&gt;IsFunction() ||<!----></span><br>        !v.As<v8::Function>()->Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        !v.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;()-&gt;Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType::kNotSkippable;<span class="line"><!---->      return mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType::kNotSkippable;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  //skip<span class="line"><!---->  //skip<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>v8::Local<v8::Value> JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<span class="line"><!---->v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<!----></span><br>    EventTarget& target) {<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget&amp; target) {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>    if (v8_listener.As<v8::Object>()<span class="line"><!---->    if (v8_listener.As&lt;v8::Object&gt;()<!----></span><br>            ->Get(isolate->GetCurrentContext(),<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;Get(isolate-&gt;GetCurrentContext(),<!----></span><br>                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>            .ToLocal(&property) &&<span class="line"><!---->            .ToLocal(&amp;property) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>        property->IsFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        property-&gt;IsFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return GetBoundFunction(property.As<v8::Function>());<span class="line"><!---->      return GetBoundFunction(property.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;());<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/service_worker/service_worker_global_scope.cc;l=2636;drc=48340c1e35efad5fb0253025dcc36b3a9573e258<a Apply the patch.diff, this is to avoid early crash referred in <span class="line"><!---->1. Apply the patch.diff, this is to avoid early crash referred in <!----></span>crbug.com/1429197<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1429197" title="Security:  Memory corruption due to accessing invalid context"><!---->crbug.com/1429197<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>2.         When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<span class="line"><!---->When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<!----></span><br>Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <span class="line"><!---->Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;

        }

        }

          width: 100%;

          justify-content: flex-start;

        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;

        }

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          padding: 0.5em 16px;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

            Issue 1429201: Security: Memory corruption due to HeapVector iterator invalidation
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      jtrro...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->jtrro...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<span class="line"><!---->In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<!----></span><br><br>bisect: This was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->bisect: This was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<!----></a><br><br>```<span {<!----></span><br>    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()->GetScriptState());<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget* et = ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>    if (!v->IsFunction() ||<span class="line"><!---->    if (!v-&gt;IsFunction() ||<!----></span><br>        !v.As<v8::Function>()->Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<!----></span><br>    EventTarget& target) {<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget&amp; target) {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>    if (v8_listener.As<v8::Object>()<span class="line"><!---->    if (v8_listener.As&lt;v8::Object&gt;()<!----></span><br>            ->Get(isolate->GetCurrentContext(),<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;Get(isolate-&gt;GetCurrentContext(),<!----></span><br>                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>            .ToLocal(&property) &&<span class="line"><!---->            .ToLocal(&amp;property) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>        property->IsFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        property-&gt;IsFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return GetBoundFunction(property.As<v8::Function>());<span class="line"><!---->      return GetBoundFunction(property.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;());<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1]         When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<span class="line"><!---->When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<!----></span><br>Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <span class="line"><!---->Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Now that this fix has had enough bake time on Canary it doesn't appear to result in any issues to prevent it from being merged; however, I notice the mentions of the spec update not being merged in a few comments above -- what is the status of that? Are there any issues if this fix is merged without the spec updated being merged? <span class="line"><!---->Now that this fix has had enough bake time on Canary it doesn't appear to result in any issues to prevent it from being merged; however, I notice the mentions of the spec update not being merged in a few comments above -- what is the status of that? Are there any issues if this fix is merged without the spec updated being merged? <!----></span><br><br>Pending the responses to this, merge tentatively approved for M113 and M112 <span class="line"><!---->Pending the responses to this, merge tentatively approved for M113 and M112 <!----></span><br>As long as there are no issues potentially introduced by asymmetrically merging this fix without the spec change, please merge this fix to branch 5672 before EOD tomorrow / Tuesday, 11 April so this fix can be included in the next M113/beta release on Wednesday. <span class="line"><!---->As long as there are no issues potentially introduced by asymmetrically merging this fix without the spec change, please merge this fix to branch 5672 before EOD tomorrow / Tuesday, 11 April so this fix can be included in the next M113/beta release on Wednesday. <!----></span><br><br>Please also merge this fix to branch 5615 by EOD Thursday, 13 April, so this fix can be included in the M112/Stable respin release on Tuesday.<span class="line"><!---->Please also merge this fix to branch 5615 by EOD Thursday, 13 April, so this fix can be included in the M112/Stable respin release on Tuesday.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        1. Just <span class="line"><!---->1. Low, only a simple conflict with a missing file<span class="line"><!---->2.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>


      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<span class="line"><!---->In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<!----></span><br><br>bisect: This was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->bisect: This was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<!----></a><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType<span class="line"><!---->mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType() {<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType() {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  for (RegisteredEventListener& e : *elv) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (RegisteredEventListener&amp; e : *elv) {<!----></span><br>    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()->GetScriptState());<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()-&gt;GetScriptState());<!----></span><br>    v8::Local<v8::Value> v =<span class="line"><!---->    v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; v =<!----></span><br>        To<JSBasedEventListener>(e.Callback())->GetEffectiveFunction(*et);    // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->        To&lt;JSBasedEventListener&gt;(e.Callback())-&gt;GetEffectiveFunction(*et);    // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>    if (!v->IsFunction() ||<span class="line"><!---->    if (!v-&gt;IsFunction() ||<!----></span><br>        !v.As<v8::Function>()->Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        !v.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;()-&gt;Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType::kNotSkippable;<span class="line"><!---->      return mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType::kNotSkippable;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  //skip<span class="line"><!---->  //skip<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>v8::Local<v8::Value> JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<span class="line"><!---->v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<!----></span><br>    EventTarget& target) {<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget&amp; target) {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>    if (v8_listener.As<v8::Object>()<span class="line"><!---->    if (v8_listener.As&lt;v8::Object&gt;()<!----></span><br>            ->Get(isolate->GetCurrentContext(),<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;Get(isolate-&gt;GetCurrentContext(),<!----></span><br>                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>            .ToLocal(&property) &&<span class="line"><!---->            .ToLocal(&amp;property) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>        property->IsFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        property-&gt;IsFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return GetBoundFunction(property.As<v8::Function>());<span class="line"><!---->      return GetBoundFunction(property.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;());<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/service_worker/service_worker_global_scope.cc;l=2636;drc=48340c1e35efad5fb0253025dcc36b3a9573e258<a Apply the patch.diff, this is to avoid early crash referred in <span class="line"><!---->1. Apply the patch.diff, this is to avoid early crash referred in <!----></span>crbug.com/1429197<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1429197" title="Security:  Memory corruption due to accessing invalid context"><!---->crbug.com/1429197<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>2. Host poc.html & worker.js<span class="line"><!---->2. Host poc.html &amp; worker.js<!----></span><br>python -m http.server 8000<span class="line"><!---->python -m http.server 8000<!----></span><br>3. out\release\chrome.exe <span class="line"><!---->3. out\release\chrome.exe <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<span class="line"><!---->When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<!----></span><br>Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <span class="line"><!---->Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.           </h1>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<span class="line"><!---->In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<!----></span><br><br>bisect: This was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->bisect: This was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<!----></a><br><br>```<span {<!----></span><br>    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()->GetScriptState());<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()-&gt;GetScriptState());<!----></span><br>    v8::Local<v8::Value> v =<span class="line"><!---->    v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; v =<!----></span><br>        To<JSBasedEventListener>(e.Callback())->GetEffectiveFunction(*et);    // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->        To&lt;JSBasedEventListener&gt;(e.Callback())-&gt;GetEffectiveFunction(*et);    // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>    if (!v->IsFunction() ||<span class="line"><!---->    if (!v-&gt;IsFunction() ||<!----></span><br>        !v.As<v8::Function>()->Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        !v.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;()-&gt;Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType::kNotSkippable;<span }<!----></span><br>  //skip<span class="line"><!---->  //skip<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>v8::Local<v8::Value> JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<span class="line"><!---->v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<!----></span><br>    EventTarget& target) {<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget&amp; target) {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>    if (v8_listener.As<v8::Object>()<span class="line"><!---->    if (v8_listener.As&lt;v8::Object&gt;()<!----></span><br>            ->Get(isolate->GetCurrentContext(),<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;Get(isolate-&gt;GetCurrentContext(),<!----></span><br>                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>            .ToLocal(&property) &&<span class="line"><!---->            .ToLocal(&amp;property) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>        property->IsFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        property-&gt;IsFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return GetBoundFunction(property.As<v8::Function>());<span class="line"><!---->      return GetBoundFunction(property.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;());<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/service_worker/service_worker_global_scope.cc;l=2636;drc=48340c1e35efad5fb0253025dcc36b3a9573e258<a Apply the patch.diff, this is to avoid early crash referred in <span class="line"><!---->1.         When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<span class="line"><!---->When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<!----></span><br>Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <span class="line"><!---->Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Now that this fix has had enough bake time on Canary it doesn't appear to result in any issues to prevent it from being merged; however, I notice the mentions of the spec update not being merged in a few comments above -- what is the status of that?         Same as <span class="line"><!---->Same as <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1429197#c29<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1429197#c29"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1429197#c29<!----></a><br><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br><br>Yes.  The code has been implemented for M106, and M108 must be affected.<span class="line"><!---->Yes.  The code has been implemented for M106, and M108 must be affected.<!----></span><br><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<!----></span><br><br>Yes, but this fix must be independent from the changes.  That is because:<span class="line"><!---->Yes, but this fix must be independent from the changes.  That is because:<!----></span><br>- the fix only updates the way to decide fetch_handler_type, and the code change won't be scattered.  User of the fetch_handler_type do not need to be updated for the change.<span class="line"><!---->- the fix only updates the way to decide fetch_handler_type, and the code change won't be scattered.  User of the fetch_handler_type do not need to be updated for the change.<!----></span><br>- and, major implementations for the feature has already been shipped as M106, and no large scale code update is needed for the way we handle fetch_handler_type.<span class="line"><!---->- and, major implementations for the feature has already been shipped as M106, and no large scale code update is needed for the way we handle fetch_handler_type.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        1. Just <span class="line"><!---->1. Low, only a simple conflict with a missing file<span class="line"><!---->2.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            </div>
          </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<span class="line"><!---->In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<!----></span><br><br>bisect: This was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->bisect: This was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<!----></a><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType<span class="line"><!---->mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType<!----></span><br>ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType() {<span class="line"><!---->ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType() {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  for (RegisteredEventListener& e : *elv) {<span class="line"><!---->  for (RegisteredEventListener&amp; e : *elv) {<!----></span><br>    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()->GetScriptState());<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget* et = EventTarget::Create(ScriptController()-&gt;GetScriptState());<!----></span><br>    v8::Local<v8::Value> v =<span class="line"><!---->    v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; v =<!----></span><br>        To<JSBasedEventListener>(e.Callback())->GetEffectiveFunction(*et);    // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->        To&lt;JSBasedEventListener&gt;(e.Callback())-&gt;GetEffectiveFunction(*et);    // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>    if (!v->IsFunction() ||<span class="line"><!---->    if (!v-&gt;IsFunction() ||<!----></span><br>        !v.As<v8::Function>()->Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        !v.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;()-&gt;Experimental_IsNopFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return mojom::blink::ServiceWorkerFetchHandlerType::kNotSkippable;<span
