}<!----></span><br>  //skip<span class="line"><!---->  //skip<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>v8::Local<v8::Value> JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<span class="line"><!---->v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction(<!----></span><br>    EventTarget& target) {<span class="line"><!---->    EventTarget&amp; target) {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>    if (v8_listener.As<v8::Object>()<span class="line"><!---->    if (v8_listener.As&lt;v8::Object&gt;()<!----></span><br>            ->Get(isolate->GetCurrentContext(),<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;Get(isolate-&gt;GetCurrentContext(),<!----></span><br>                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->                  V8AtomicString(isolate, "handleEvent"))    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>            .ToLocal(&property) &&<span class="line"><!---->            .ToLocal(&amp;property) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>        property->IsFunction()) {<span class="line"><!---->        property-&gt;IsFunction()) {<!----></span><br>      return GetBoundFunction(property.As<v8::Function>());<span class="line"><!---->      return GetBoundFunction(property.As&lt;v8::Function&gt;());<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] Apply the patch.diff, this is to avoid early crash referred in <span class="line"><!---->1. Host poc.html &amp; worker.js<!----></span><br>python -m http.server 8000<span class="line"><!---->python -m http.server 8000<!----></span><br>3. out\release\chrome.exe <span class="line"><!---->3.         When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<span class="line"><!---->When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<!----></span><br>Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <span class="line"><!---->Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Yoshisato Yanagisawa &lt;<!----></span>yyanagisawa@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yyanagisawa@chromium.org"><!---->yyanagisawa@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Apr 05 11:47:04 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Apr 05 11:47:04 2023<!----></span><br><br>Stop supporting { handleEvent }.<span class="line"><!---->Stop supporting { handleEvent }.<!----></span><br><br>Make the code aligned with the following specification update:<span class="line"><!---->Make the code aligned with the following specification update:<!----></span><br>https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/pull/1676<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/pull/1676"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/pull/1676<!----></a><br><br>With the previous specification and code, event listener vector<span class="line"><!---->With the previous specification and code, event listener vector<!----></span><br>can be modified during the GetEffectiveFunction execution, which may<span class="line"><!---->can be modified during the GetEffectiveFunction execution, which may<!----></span><br>bring unexpected vector state.<span class="line"><!---->bring unexpected vector state.<!----></span><br><br>Change-Id: I732c4c9ab2caebc49a7f4ef52640df7b8476d838<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I732c4c9ab2caebc49a7f4ef52640df7b8476d838<!----></span><br>Bug: 1429201<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<span class="line"><!---->1. Which CLs should be backmerged? (Please include Gerrit links.)<!----></span><br><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4394402<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4394402"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4394402<!----></a><br><br>2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<span class="line"><!---->2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<!----></span><br><br>maybe.<span class="line"><!---->maybe.<!----></span><br>It is included in <span class="line"><!---->It is included in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/114.0.5698.0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/114.0.5698.0"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/114.0.5698.0<!----></a><br><br>3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has this fix been verified to not pose any stability regressions and does it pose potential stability risks?<!----></span><br><br>We have tests to confirm the behavior under typical service worker usages.<span class="line"><!---->We have tests to confirm the behavior under typical service worker usages.<!----></span><br>The CL has been merged after checked by such tests.<span class="line"><!---->The CL has been merged after checked by such tests.<!----></span><br><br>4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this fix pose any known compatibility risks?<!----></span><br><br>Pragmatically, no.<span class="line"><!---->Pragmatically, no.<!----></span><br>However, it is fair to say yes technically because the fix has been merged before waiting for the specification fix: <span class="line"><!---->However, it is fair to say yes technically because the fix has been merged before waiting for the specification fix: <!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/pull/1676<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/pull/1676"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/pull/1676<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>But as you can see in <span class="line"><!---->But as you can see in <!----></span>https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/815<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/815"><!---->https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/815<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> no other major browser vendors seem to follow our latest proposal released in <span class="line"><!----> no other major browser vendors seem to follow our latest proposal released in <!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/issues/1671<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/issues/1671"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/ServiceWorker/issues/1671<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span>  There should not be actual compatibility issues.<span class="line"><!---->  There should not be actual compatibility issues.<!----></span><br><br>5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->5. Does it require manual verification by the test team? Yoshisato Yanagisawa &lt;<!----></span>yyanagisawa@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yyanagisawa@chromium.org"><!---->yyanagisawa@chromium.org<!----></a>><span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<span class="line"><!---->In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<!----></span><br><br>bisect: This was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->bisect: This was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<span class="line"><!---->When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<!----></span><br>Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <span class="line"><!---->Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<span class="line"><!---->In function ServiceWorkerGlobalScope::FetchHandlerType, it iterates all registered fetch event listeners and calls JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction to get the listener function [1]. JSEventListener::GetEffectiveFunction may calls v8::Object::Get to retrieve the "handleEvent" property of the listener object [2], which may executes user defined JS code and invalidates the iterator by removing fetch event listeners.<!----></span><br><br>bisect: This was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->bisect: This was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6306836d087b41de48780b8d4e7b1f0bd35de365<!----></a><br><br>```<span         When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<span class="line"><!---->When I defined the specification, I tried to follow GetEffectiveFunction behavior because I did not recognize the attack like this.  However, it seems to bring modification of the event listener list by defining the get function that modifies the event listener list.  What do you think if I make it not support the handleEvent property?<!----></span><br>Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <span class="line"><!---->Especially, I suggest to omit Step 4 in <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/ServiceWorker/#all-fetch-listeners-are-empty-algorithm<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Has this fix been tested on Canary?<span class="line"><!---->2. Has this fix been tested on Canary?<!----></span><br>3.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
